intro: Howelliella ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf howelliella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Howelliella ovata is adapted to arid conditions and has a shallow root system to maximize water absorption. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
